data.title: Redesign the "Open/Closed slots" drop-down menu a little bit

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Hello.

I think the RA drop-down menu (to choose if a slot is open or closed) would look prettier if separators' buttons were not pressed:

data.title: Suggestion: auto target priorities
data.body:
would be nice if units could auto prioritise 

the prioritisation doesnt have to be too specific, but can be class-based

eg an apc/ranger would prioritise inf>buildings>vehicles, a tank would prioritise vehicles>structures>inf, an artillery/v2 would prioritise buildings>inf>vehicles

some notes:
- by default, units should attack the 1st target to come within their range
- priorities should kick in X sec only after a target has been chosen for attack, where X is the auto-target scan interval
- target priorities and scanning should only work when using attack-move or guarding (ie, when units pick targets by themselves); when the player issues a particular attack order on a target, the unit should continue shooting it until it dies or is out of range.

data.title: Renderer cleanup
data.body:
This brings the renderer code more in line with our coding style and removes the bogus special-case key handling.

If Windows/SDL still doesn't handle alt-f4 properly (and we still want to keep a workaround) then it should be reimplemented inside an if (windows) check, and not forced on everyone.

data.title: Show in my own radar, my own Gap Generator effect
data.body:
I don't remember very well how it was in Red Alert 1, but I think that when building a Gap Generator or a Mobile Gap Generator, in your own radar the area that is affected by the gap turns a little bit dark, of course, you can still see your units an buldings, but you have an idea of what you are hiding.

So, my suggestion is to add this feature.

Thanks

In this video, pdox and nuke both have BuildLimit: 1.

data.title: Native R8 support for sequences
data.body:
This cleans up and enables the R8Reader for ingame sequences (but not cursors).
See 56e7925 for example vehicle, infantry, and turret sequences.

Sprites are centered on the reference point defined in the frame header (which isn't related to the frame size at all). For vehicles this is the center of the unit; infantry is at their feet, and buildings is something weird that may be well outside the sequence artwork. The Offset sequence key can be used to reposition the artwork to its desired position.

data.title: Add atom bomb and gps public superweapon timers to RA
The burning chinook husk in the Pluto map disappears shortly after the game starts
data.body: Pinging @wuschel

data.title: Extra Tabs and UI for each side for C&C (And one other thing)
data.body:
Basically, the same thing on how it's set up in RA. There's a Ship tab and a Soviet and Allied UI for RA, but it's not possible for C&C. It'd be nice to add this so the C&C has a bit more modding capability, also making it so people don't have to convert C&C to RA.

And if it's also not too much trouble, could the Animations such as the flashing arrows on the refinery and the Helipad be added with how they work in C&C1? Thanks. =)

data.title: Add support for TS/RA2 split-shadows.
data.body:
This adds 3 new fields to sequences:
- **ShadowStart** sets the start index of the shadow frames for the sequence (defaults to -1, i.e no shadow).
- **ZOffset** sets a relative z-offset for the sequence (to be used for overlays; defaults to 0).
- **ShadowZOffset** sets a relative z-offset for the shadow sequence (defaults to -5).

data.title: Allow the AI to look for more space to build
data.body: fixing #3569, the AI choose only places where it is near the base (reverting d08d3d6 from #3143) and fixing a bug that if the place that AI finds to build is not near the base, it stops looking for more places. now it continues to find more

data.title: AI cannot find space to build, but human players can
data.body:
mod: Red Alert
using the source form branch bleed

Playing the map Ghost Town, the MCV is surrounded by wire-walls, AI deploy the MCV and then try to build Power Plant, but AI cannot place it anywhere.., and it loops forever trying to place it, but it does not say that there is not space left. (something like #3189)

Playing as Human, there IS space to place the Power Plant.

I tried to debug the AI, ai.ChooseBuildLocation() (at BaseBuilder.cs) returns a place to build, but, when executing ai.world.IssueOrder(new Order("PlaceBuilding", ai.p.PlayerActor, false), it fails, the building cannot be placed because it is not close enough to base.
I saw ChooseBuildLocation() does not check if the place is near the base (distanceToBaseIsImportant == false). if distsanceToBaseIsImportant is true, then the AI says there is no space left, cancel the production, and re-build the power plant, and keeps looping (like #3189)

data.title: RALint: Trait prerequisites not satisfied (or prerequisite loop) calls wrong Missing= trait
data.body:
It will always tell the first one, not the one that is actually missing which is confusing as we have some complex examples.

``` yaml
RenderVoxels:
WithVoxelBodyInfo:
```

will fail because `BodyOrientation:` is missing.

However it will spit out

```
RALint(1,1): Error: Actor apc is not constructible; failure: Trait prerequisites not satisfied (or prerequisite loop) Actor=apc Unresolved=RenderVoxelsInfo,WithVoxelBodyInfo Missing=RenderVoxelsInfo
```

which is not helpful in this case.
